stimulus:
In this study, you will read text scenarios and make slider judgments about the situations which they describe. Here is an image of an example trial.


In the upcoming trials, please read the descriptions and give your answer by clicking on the slider. Please read each scenario description carefully, but we are interested in your intuitive judgment so no need to second-guess yourself.

You must make a slider judgment in each trial. You will not receive any feedback.


When you are ready to begin, press the start button.

Sam apologizes to his coworker, Rachel, for missing a call during a meeting.
Sam: "I didn't see your call; I was in a meeting."
Rachel: "That's understandable; we often have back-to-back meetings."

How polite is Rachel being?

Ms. Johnson hands back graded essays to her students and gives feedback.
Ms. Johnson: "Your essay was very impressive. Well done."

How polite is Ms. Johnson being?

Anna explains why she decided to postpone her vacation to her friend Dan.
Anna: "I think I need to save more money before I can go."
Dan: "That's slightly understandable; budgeting is important."

How polite is Dan being?

Rachel gives feedback on Michael's draft presentation.
Michael: "I appreciate your suggestions. You've been extremely helpful in improving this."

How polite is Michael being?

Alex is attending a lecture, but a group of students nearby is talking loudly, making it hard to hear the professor.
Alex: "It's extremely difficult to listen to the lecture with all the talking. Could you keep it down, please?"

How polite is Alex being?

Anna tells her professor that she needs a few extra days to complete an assignment due to family obligations.
Anna: "I'm really sorry, but could I have an extension on the assignment? I had a family emergency."
Professor: "That's understandable, Anna. Take the extra time you need."

How polite is the professor being?

A sales assistant helps Megan find the exact item she was looking for after searching through multiple aisles.
Megan: "I appreciate your help finding this. You've been quite helpful."

How polite is Megan being?

Emma invites her friend Alex over for dinner and cooks a homemade meal.
Emma: "I wasn't sure if you'd like it. I tried a new recipe."
Alex: "It's quite impressive! I think the flavors really come together nicely."

How polite is Alex being?

Rachel notices that her friend has been looking stressed and overwhelmed.
Rachel: "You've been really busy with work lately. It's making me concerned about how you're handling everything."

How polite is Rachel being?

During a class discussion, Emily expresses concerns about a peer.
Emily: "I'm slightly concerned about Jake; he hasn't been participating in class and seems really withdrawn."

How polite is Emily being?

David observes that his colleague has been distant.
David: "I've noticed you haven't been as chatty as usual. I'm extremely concerned if everything is okay at home."

How polite is David being?

After a trip to an art museum, Emily talks about her favorite exhibits.
Emily: "The contemporary art section was fascinating! I could spend hours there!"
David: "I thought it was boring. I didn't really understand the art."

How polite is David being?

Sarah is interning at a company, and her boss, Mr. Thompson asks to stay to finish up her report.
Mr. Thompson: Can you stay late today to help finish up the report?
Sarah: "I'm feeling slightly exhausted after the back-to-back meetings today, so I'm not sure I'd be at my best. Would it be alright if I leave come in early tomorrow to finish it up?"

How polite is Sarah being?

Ben's cousin Amy asks him if he's coming to their monthly family gathering:
Amy: "Are you coming to the family dinner this evening?"
Ben: "I'd love to, but I'm quite exhausted from work this week. I'll catch up with everyone next time."

How polite is Ben being?

After watching a slow-paced romantic drama, Lisa shares her thoughts with Jake.
Lisa: "I thought that movie was so beautiful! The emotions were just perfect."
Jake: "Honestly for me, it was very boring. I was hoping for more action."

How polite is Jake being?

Ben's cousin Amy asks him if he's coming to their monthly family gathering:
Amy: "Are you coming to the family dinner this evening?"
Ben: "I'd love to, but I'm exhausted from work this week. I'll catch up with everyone next time."

How polite is Ben being?

Rachel notices that her friend has been looking stressed and overwhelmed.
Rachel: "You've been really busy with work lately. It's making me very concerned about how you're handling everything."

How polite is Rachel being?

Chris's friend Emma asks if you want to join her on a weekend trip:
Emma: "We're planning a spontaneous road trip this weekend. Want to join?"
Chris: "That sounds awesome, but I'm exhausted from traveling all week. I think I need some downtime instead."

How polite is Chris being?

Sarah: "I'm feeling exhausted after the back-to-back meetings today, so I'm not sure I'd be at my best. Would it be alright if I leave come in early tomorrow to finish it up?"

How polite is Sarah being?

Amy's boyfriend Jake wants to talk about their date this weekend, but Amy is tired:
Jake: "Hey, can we talk about this weekend?"
Amy: "I'm kind of exhausted right now. Would it be okay if we talk about it tomorrow instead?"

How polite is Amy being?

Lisa is working in an open-plan office, but her colleague is having a loud phone conversation nearby.
Lisa: "It's slightly difficult to concentrate with the phone call being that loud. Would you mind lowering your voice a little?"

How polite is Lisa being?

A traveler, Sam, asks an airport staff member where to find a particular gate.
Sam: "Thanks for pointing me in the right direction. You've been helpful."

How polite is Sam being?

During a group project, Alex helps Jessica by clarifying some confusing instructions.
Jessica: "I appreciate you taking the time to explain that. You've been helpful."

How polite is Jessica being?

Sophie asks Daniel if he can call later tonight:
Sophie: "Can I call you to chat later tonight? I could use some advice."
Daniel: "I'd love to help, but I'm very exhausted and might fall asleep. Can we talk tomorrow?"

How polite is Daniel being?

Claire is studying for an exam, but her younger siblings are playing noisily in the next room.
Claire: "It's very difficult to study with all the noise. Can you please be a bit quieter?"

How polite is Claire being?

David observes that his colleague has been distant.
David: "I've noticed you haven't been as chatty as usual. I'm concerned if everything is okay at home."

How polite is David being?

Amy is trying to study in her room, but her roommate, Jake, is playing music loudly in the living room.
Amy: "Hey Jake, it's kind of difficult to concentrate with the music so loud. Do you think you could turn it down a bit?"

How polite is Amy being?

Emma invites her friend Alex over for dinner and cooks a homemade meal.
Emma: "I wasn't sure if you'd like it. I tried a new recipe."
Alex: "It's impressive! I think the flavors really come together nicely."

How polite is Alex being?

Melissa's coworker shares their positive experience at a networking event.
Colleague: "I enjoyed the event and made some great connections."
Melissa: "Honestly, I found the event quite boring. I struggled to find conversations that interested me."

How polite is Melissa being?

John invites his friend Alex to a weekend camping trip, but Alex declines because of he is tired.
Alex: "I'd love to go, but I think I need some rest this weekend."
John: "That's kind of understandable. You've been taking on a lot recently. We can plan another trip later in the year."

How polite is John being?

Sarah is at a restaurant with friends, but the background music is too loud to have a conversation.
Sarah: "It's quite difficult to talk with the music this loud. Could you ask the staff to turn it down a little?"

How polite is Sarah being?

Jo's manager shares their thoughts on a recent company webinar.
Manager: "The webinar on productivity strategies was so enlightening."
Jo: "I thought it was boring. The content didn't really resonate with me."

How polite is Jo being?
